newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-REEVE STEPS INTO NEW ROLE.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-REEVE STEPS INTO NEW ROLE.

text.p: Dermot Reeve has been confirmed as Somerset's new coach for the 1997 season following his retirement from the game with a hip injury.

The Hong Kong-born 33-year-old former all-rounder led Warwickshire to a unique `treble' in English county cricket in 1994 and is hoping the return of Pakistan leg spinner Mushtaq Ahmed will encourage similar success at Taunton.
"I want to bring in a more professional approach, while creating a relaxed environment which will encourage the players to produce their best," he said.
